<small>Also see: [[H7163]] | [[H3583]]</small>

 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פּוּךְ‎</span> **noun [masculine]** ==antimony, stibium== (Late Hebrew = Biblical Hebrew; compare possibly Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***open, separate***; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***pulverize***; but <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פּוּךְ‎</span> perhaps foreign word); — black mineral powder, for increasing brilliance of eyes by darkening edges of lids; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתָּשֶׂם בֵּפּ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֵינֶוהָ‎</span> [[2Kgs.9.30|2Kgs 9:30]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּקְרְעִי וגו‎</span> [[Jer.4.30|Jer 4:30]] (on practice in Arabic see [[BDB#We|We]]<sup>GGN, 1893, 443</sup>; in Egypt, [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>Mod.Egypt.ed. 5, i. 45 f.</sup>); figurative [[Isa.54.11|Isa 54:11]] of dark cement setting off precious stones (but [[BDB#We|We]]<sup>DLZ, Aug. 2, 1890</sup> [[BDB#Che|Che]]<sup>Hpt</sup> and others read  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֹפֶךְ‎</span> q. v.); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַבְנֵי פ‎</span> [[1Chr.29.2|1Chr 29:2]] are perhaps stones of brilliant hue of antimony. — compare proper name <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קֶרֶן הַפּוּךְ‎</span>, and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּחַל‎</span>.
